metadata.synopsis: Players meet Daisy in person for the first time. Daisy will invite the player to kill them, knowing that Vlaakith has ordered the player to do so. The player will be able to ask Daisy about the astral prison, the Absolute, and why the gith are after them,
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to act 1b. Go the security office and accept or refuse Vlaakith's mission. 284; 2; 305SetGlobalOsirisFlag CRE_ChainOfCommand_State_PlanecasterActive Insert the Artefact into the planecaster objectOnce in the astral prison, follow the wisp to its final destination and talk to it.

107.text: I may have made a mistake trusting you.
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Inside the Astral plane, the player spots Daisy, They're fully awake, no dreaming now.InternalNodeContext: Little pan on Daisy looking at the void in front of them before the player walks in and they start talking.NodeContext: Looking at the void, not at the player.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: I told you to stay away from the githyanki. But you just couldn't help yourself, could you?
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking back over their shoulder while finishing the line. NodeContext: Looking at the void, not at the player for the first part. Looking back over their shoulder while saying "Could you".

75.text: And now you've come here to murder me.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy turns aournd by the right and faces the player who walks close to them.

160.text: Still, refusing a githyanki queen's orders... That was bold.
160.context: NodeContext: With begrudging respect. Looking at the void, not at the player.

28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy turns aournd by the right and with a gesture of the hand, invites the player to come closer.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Vlaakith told me you are an agent of the illithid Grand Design.

96.text: I told you I stole the artefact from someone - well, I stole it from Vlaakith.

0.text: Since then, she has become desperate.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Everyone always thinks I want to murder them! I just want to talk.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Explain. Now. Or I'll do what I do best.

123.text: Very well. What do you want to know?

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Why does Vlaakith want you dead?

159.text: Vlaakith wants me dead because I know her secret.

116.text: I told you already. I'm just like you. An adventurer from Baldur's Gate who was infected with an illithid tadpole and seeks to be free of the Absolute.

50.text: I'm just like you. An adventurer from Baldur's Gate that was infected with an illithid tadpole and seeks to be free of the Absolute.

34.text: But unlike you, unlike anyone else in any plane, I know Vlaakith's secret.

145.text: It is a secret so great that if her people ever found out, that would be the end of her rule, the end of her.

24.text: That same secret is how I've been protecting you from the Absolute.

35.text: I can hear your thoughts. You think I'm lying. Vlaakith warned you that I would try to deceive you. But consider this - what reason have I to deceive you? I want the same thing as you - freedom.

19.text: I'm on your side. I have been since the very beginning.

112.text: I told Vlaakith I wouldn't kill you. I meant what I said. Get up.
112.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy draws a sword offering it to the player  hilt first, inviting them to take it.

Daisy kneels on the ground in front of the player.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I told Vlaakith I wouldn't kill you. I meant what I said. Get up.
131.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Daisy stands up and stows stows the sword.

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the ground

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Get up - you won't die today.
52.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Daisy stands up and stows stows the sword.

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the ground

48.text: It seems I was right to put my faith in you after all. Thank you.
48.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Daisy stands up and stows stows the sword.

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the ground

82.text: Vlaakith will be furious - to make no mention of your githyanki companion.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy gives a wry smile.

38.text: The lich queen fears nothing more than the loss of her empire. The knowledge I have of her deception will bring that about.

157.text: Vlaakith will be furious. She fears nothing more than the loss of her empire. The knowledge I have of her deception will bring that about.
157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy gives a wry smile.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Vlaakith's a goddess. What could you possibly know that would bring down her empire?
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

111.text: Godlike in power, yes. But with none of the sanctity.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: If you're such a threat to her, why hasn't she killed you already?
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

61.text: She is trying her very best to kill me. By sending you.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

90.text: Queen Vlaakith is lying to you and your people. You think she knows how mother Gith defeated the Illithid Empire.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

22.text: But she does not. If the illithids would ever rise to power again, she would be incapable of stopping them.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

113.text: And if her deception were ever to come to light, her impotence, her rule would be over.
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

56.text: And if her people found out about her impotence, there would be mutiny, revolution, the end of her rule.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

161.text: But that very power - the power to resist illithid control - which Vlaakith only pretends to know, is how I've been protecting you.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

14.text: I suppose she hoped to extract it from my corpse.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

11.text: Since you spared me that fate, she will come for you.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

108.speaker: Player
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

72.speaker: Player
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

137.speaker: Player
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

156.text: I did warn you not to come here.

42.text: But that curious streak of yours has brought us this far. I believe you will overcome this, too.

143.speaker: Player
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

130.text: And yet you did not. I can only assume there was something you felt was worth saving.

54.speaker: Player
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

17.text: A logical question. But you're not ready for the answer.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

144.text: I have delayed long enough. The next attack is overdue, and I can't risk you being caught in the middle of it. I need you out there, searching for the Absolute.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the distance, sounds of battle (same as we heard in the first dream), darkening skies. A military order is given to attack. Daisy glances over their shoulder.

5.text: You were on the right path - to Moonrise Towers. Return to it.

128.text: I hope you are ready to face Vlaakith's wrath. The entire crèche stands ready to kill you in her name.

162.text: Be warned. The Inquisitor awaits your return from this place with orders to kill you. No doubt the rest of the crèche will join him.

83.text: You must go to Moonrise Towers. That is where the cultists are gathering.

8.text: Vlaakith is lying to her people. She pretends to know how Gith destroyed the mind flayer empire. In truth, she knows nothing.

109.text: If the Illithid Empire were ever to return, she would be incapable of stopping them.

150.text: Vlaakith is lying to the githyanki. They believe she knows how their beloved mother Gith defeated the mind flayer empire.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You claim to know a lot about my queen, and yet you present no evidence.

4.text: You stood in her presence yourself. Was it not enough to convince you of her fear? Her desperation?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Vlaakith be damned - if she wants you dead, she can kill you herself.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Is this some kind of trick?

23.text: I already told you I protect you, that I saved you.

25.text: If this was not enough to convince you, what more is there to say?

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I'm sorry. I don't want to do this, but I'm more afraid of Vlaakith than I am of you. You have to die.
10.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player takes the blade and drives it through Daisy's chest. Daisy reacts with pain.

The player maintains their grip on the sword.

102.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player takes the blade and drives it through Daisy's chest. Daisy reacts with pain.

The player maintains their grip on the sword.

43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: deeply sad

142.text: We could have been so much more. But you had to choose this.
142.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Daisy grips the blade. Blood spreads from the wound. They fade into wisps, and vanish into the astral ether.

As Daisy fade the blade loses purchase and the find themselves stabbing empty space.

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: disappointed

76.text: So you are not to be trusted.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: A moment of stillness. Then - Daisy reforms from astral ether kneeling in the spot where they were killed. The player is shocked to see Daisy alive.

92.text: So you are not to be trusted.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: with an undercurrent of bitter disappointment

93.text: Your fear of Vlaakith consumes you.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy gets to their feet

12.text: A waste. Even now she's preparing her Inquisitor for your death. Not to mention the rest of the crèche. They will kill you on sight.

63.text: See where your distrust of me gets you?

97.text: Go on, then - face them. We will resume our discussion when I am ready to forgive you.

71.text: A waste. Even now she's preparing to kill you. The crèche is ready to destroy you in her name the moment you return there.

146.text: I don't intend to make a habit of conversing with my killer, so I will be brief.

62.text: I don't intend to make a habit of conversing with my killer, so I will be brief.

86.text: Your survival depends on mine, and mine on yours. It's less than ideal, but it is where we stand.

87.text: I know a secret that Vlaakith never wants to be revealed.

2.text: It is the reason she mobilised her people to retrieve the Astral Prism.

36.text: It is why she sent you to kill me. And why she will kill you once you leave this place.

94.text: Since we are both dependent on your ability to survive that, you would do well to remember that without me, you would become a mind flayer.

110.text: Now leave. I have a battle to return to.

154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: regretful (on the player's behalf)

133.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Daisy is shocked. 

Daisy kneeling with both knee on the groundNodeContext: bitter

29.speaker: Player
29.text: A goddess asked me to kill you. I have no choice. You have to die.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: My venerable queen has spoken. You must perish.

158.text: A prison. Commissioned by Vlaakith, built in the Hells. A place for all who threaten her to wilt and die.

138.text: The stuff of nightmares, and no concern of yours. It is enough that Vlaakith hunts me for my knowledge - it is best you remain in the dark else she will hunt you too.

79.text: You see, I know Vlaakith's secret.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I haven't come to murder you. I just want to talk.
153.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

117.speaker: Player
117.text: You have some explaining to do.
117.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Why did you stop the zaith'isk from removing my tadpole?
101.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

103.text: You misunderstand. The zaith'isk was going to kill you. I couldn't let that happen.
103.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

155.text: It is the very least of Queen Vlaakith's deceptions.
155.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

124.speaker: Player
124.text: What else is she lying about?
124.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

37.text: A secret that I know, and Vlaakith doesn't.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I'm not interested in Vlaakith. I'm interested in you - who are you, really?
114.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

7.speaker: Player
7.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

80.text: There's no lie. I would never lie to you.
80.context: NodeContext: genuine - this isn't a lie

104.speaker: Player
104.text: *In spite of your reservations, she's telling the truth.*

163.text: *In spite of your reservations, she's telling the truth.*

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *In spite of your reservations, they're telling the truth.*

41.text: The githyanki had no intention of letting you survive purification. And I had no intention of letting you die.

149.text: The githyanki had no intention of letting you survive purification. And I had no intention of letting you die.

91.text: And now that you know the truth, what will you do?

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Try to probe into the figure's mind.

136.text: That was uncalled for. Though, a spell well cast.

9.text: That was uncalled for. Though, a spell well cast.

66.text: I suppose I can't blame you. You are threatened by the tadpole and you think I prevented you from being cured.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just focus on player face as their mind is blown.

148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just focus on player face as their mind is blown.

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *A palace of memories opens up to you, separated into segments. Within one segment, you see it - the truth, exactly as the figure said. They saved your life.*
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just focus on player face as their mind is blown.

27.text: Must you? Really? If you were going to do it, at least you could have tried harder than that.

51.text: Must you? Really? If you were going to do it, at least you could have tried harder than that.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: You are mistaken. I'm here to kill you.
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy hands player a shortswordNodeContext: Weary

65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy hands player a shortswordNodeContext: Weary

49.text: I already told you I protect you, that I saved you.

59.text: If this was not enough to convince you, what more is there to say?

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Perhaps I should hear you out.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy puts the sword away

139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy puts the sword away

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Is this some sort of trick?

125.speaker: Player
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy hands player a shortswordNodeContext: Weary

121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy hands player a shortswordNodeContext: Weary
